SEARCH
Package polimi.ingsw.model

Class Playground

java.lang.Object
polimi.ingsw.model.Playground
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, PlaygroundIC
public class Playground extends Object implements Serializable, PlaygroundIC
Playground class Playground is the class that represents the playground of the game and contains all the tiles We have a matrix of tiles and a bag of tiles. The bag is used to pick a tile randomly to fulfill the matrix
See Also:

      public boolean checkBeforeGrab(int r, int c, Direction direction, int num)
      Description copied from interface: PlaygroundIC
      This method is used to check if the tile actually exists in the playground
      Specified by:
      checkBeforeGrab in interface PlaygroundIC
      Parameters:
      r - row of the tiles the player wants to pick up
      c - column of the tiles the player wants to pick up
      direction - direction in which the player wants tto pick up tiles
      num - number of tiles the player wants to pick up
      Returns:
      true if the player can pick up the tiles, false if he can't

    • allTileHaveAllFreeSide

      public boolean allTileHaveAllFreeSide()
      Description copied from interface: PlaygroundIC
      This method check if all the tiles have at least one free side
      Specified by:
      allTileHaveAllFreeSide in interface PlaygroundIC
      Returns:
      true if every tile has 4 free sides, meaning the playground must be refilled

    • grabTile

      public List<Tile> grabTile(int r, int c, Direction direction, int num) throws TileGrabbedNotCorrectException
      Parameters:
      r - row of the tiles the player wants to pick up
      c - column of the tiles the player wants to pick up
      direction - direction in which the player wants tto pick up tiles
      num - number of tiles the player wants to pick up
      Returns:
      a list of grabbed tiles
      Throws:
      TileGrabbedNotCorrectException - if the player selected tiles he couldn't pick up
